title: Pneumatic Soft Actuator Test Stand
description: Designed and built a modular soft actuator test stand for the MIT Fabrication-Integrated Design Lab. The stand is used for characterizing the motion, lifetime, and pressure limits of soft actuators in a highly controlled and repeatable manner. This project included development of a pneumatic PID control software system, capable of real-time pressure control up to 40 PSI with a 1 PSI deadband following customizable user-defined pressure profiles.

title: Thermal Acceleration of Soft-soft Interface Manufacturing
description: Investigated the effects of thermal acceleration on the peel strength of soft-soft interfaces. Successfully demonstrated that thermal acceleration can be used to reduce the manufacturing time of common soft robotic components by up to a factor of 55x withhout adverse effects on material properties.

title: Mass Production of Custom Injection-Molded Yo-yos
description: Led a team of 5 peers over a semester's time to manufacture injection & thermoforming molds for the production of 50+ custom designed Buzz Lightyear yo-yos, featuring a custom press-fit between the two halves of the yo-yo.

title: Autonomous Robot Design Competition
description: Placing 6th out of 138 students, this autonomous robot was the culmination of a semester of design and fabrication work, which was informed by multiple custom-built MATLAB simulations to determine necessary hardware specifications.
